title: Interactive medication delivery system

events.title: Application filed by HealthTech Services Corp
Assigned to HEALTHTECH SERVICES CORP.
description: Assignors: DI GIANFILIPPO, ALEANDRO, SAGER, TAMARA L., KAUFMAN, STEPHEN B.

abstract: A medication delivery device includes a housing containing separate first and second storage locations for holding medication dosages away from access by the user. Associated separate first and second delivery mechanisms permit selective delivery of a medication dose from either the first or second storage locations to the patient. The invention provides a control element that discriminates between the actuation of the first delivery mechanism and the second delivery mechanism, thereby discriminating between the delivery of medication housed in the first and second storage locations. The control element discriminates between different first and second input criteria. In response to the first input criteria but not is response to the second input criteria, the control element actuates the first delivery mechanism. In response to the second input criteria, the control element actuates the second delivery mechanism.
claims: 1. A medication delivery device comprisinga housing, first storage means for storing at least one dose of a medication within the housing away from access by the user, second storage means separate from the first storage means for storing at least one dose of a medication within the housing away from accessed by the user, first delivery means associated with the first storage means for selectively delivering a medication dose from the first storage means to the user by expelling it through an opening in the housing to a location accessible by the user, second delivery means associated with the second storage means for selectively delivering a medication dose from the second storage means to the user by expelling it through an opening in said housing to a location accessible to the user, and control means associated with the first and second storage means for actuating the first delivery means in response to a first criteria and for actuating the second delivery means in response to a second criteria different from the first criteria, wherein the control means includes internal memory means for storing a prescribed schedule for administering medication, and means for actuating the first delivery means in response to the prescribed schedule stored in the internal memory means and not in response to the receipt of a medication delivery command from an external input means, and external input means for receiving and interpreting at least one prescribed medication delivery command from the user, the control means actuating the second delivery means in response to the receipt of a prescribed medication delivery command from the external input means.

2. A device according to claim 1wherein a second control means actuates the second delivery means in response to either the prescribed schedule stored in the internal memory means or in response to the receipt of a prescribed medication delivery command from the external input means.
3. A device according to claim 1wherein the external input means includes speech recognition means for receiving and interpreting at least one prescribed verbal command made by the user.

4. A device according to claim 1wherein the external input means is further capable of receiving and interpreting at least one change medication schedule command from the user, and further including means for altering the prescribed schedule stored in the internal memory means in response to the receipt of a prescribed change medication schedule command from the external input means.

5. A medication delivery device comprisinga housing, first storage means for storing at least one dose of a medication within the housing away from access by the user, second storage means separate from the first storage means for storing at least one dose of a medication within the housing away from access by the user, first delivery means associated with the first storage means for selectively delivering a medication dose from the first storage means to the user, second delivery means associated with the second storage means for selectively delivering a medication dose from the second storage means to the user, and control means associated with the first and second storage means which includes first internal memory means for storing a first prescribed schedule for administering medication, second internal memory means for storing a second prescribed schedule for administering medication, first control means for actuating the first delivery means in response to the first prescribed schedule and not in response to the second prescribed schedule, and second control means for actuating the second delivery means in response to the second prescribed schedule.

6. A device according to claim 5wherein the control means includes external input means for receiving and interpreting at least one prescribed medication delivery command from the user, wherein the first control means actuates the first delivery means in response to the first prescribed schedule and not in response to a medication delivery command from the external input means, and wherein the second control means actuates the second delivery means in response to either the second prescribed schedule or in response to a prescribed medication delivery command from the external input means.
7. A device according to claim 6wherein the external input means includes speech recognition means for receiving and interpreting at least one prescribed verbal command made by the user.

8. A device according to claim 6wherein the external input means is further capable of receiving and interpreting at least one change medication schedule command from the user, and further including means for altering the prescribed schedule stored in at least one of the first and second internal memory means in response to the receipt of a prescribed change medication schedule command from the external input means.
9. A device according to claim 1 or 3 or 5 or 6 or 7and further including speech generation means for generating audible messages to the user.

10. A medication delivery device according to claim 2wherein said second control means includes timing means for preventing a second actuation of the second delivery means, despite the receipt of a medication delivery command, when the time period between a first and second actuation is less than a prescribed period.
11. A device according to claim 10wherein the external input means includes speech recognition means for receiving and interpreting at last one prescribed verbal command made by the user.

12. A device according to claim 10wherein the external input means is further capable of receiving and interpreting at least one change medication schedule command from the user, and further including means for altering the prescribed schedule stored in the internal memory means in response to the receipt of a prescribed change medication schedule command from the external input means.
13. A device according to claim 10and further including speech generation means for generating audible messages to the user.

14. A medication delivery device comprisinga housing, first storage means for storing at leas tone dose of a medication within the housing away from access by the user, second storage means separate from the first storage means for storing at least one dose of a medication within the housing away from access by the user, first delivery means associated with the first storage mans for selectively delivering a medication dose from the first storage means to the user, second delivery means associated with the second storage means for selectively delivering a medication dose from the second storage means to the user, internal memory means for storing a prescribed schedule for administering medication, external input means for receiving and interpreting information indicative of selected one or more health parameters of the user, first control means for actuating the first delivery means in response to the prescribed schedule stored in the internal memory means and not in response to the receipt of information by the external input means, second control means for actuating the second delivery means in response to the receipt and interpretation of health parameter information by the external input means and further including external output means for prompting preselected information from the user, wherein the external input means includes testing means for the user to measure a preselected physical parameter and response input means for receiving and interpreting responses made by the user to the prompting of the external output means, and wherein the second control means is operative for correlating the measurement by the testing means with the responses received by the response input means and for generating a control signal to actuate the second delivery means only when a predetermined correlation exists.
15. A device according to claim 14wherein the external input means includes testing means for the user to measure a preselected physical parameter.
16. A device according to claim 14 or 15wherein the external input means includes means for receiving and interpreting messages from the user.
17. A device according to claim 14and further including external output means for prompting preselected information from the user.
18. A device according to claim 14 wherein the response input means includes speech recognition means for receiving and interpreting at least one prescribed verbal response made by the user.
19. A device according to claim 18wherein the external output means includes speech generation means for generating audible messages to the user.

20. A device according to claim 14wherein the second control means includes timing means for preventing a second actuation of the second delivery means when the time period between a first and second actuation is less than a prescribed period.

21. A device according to claim 14wherein the external input means is further capable of receiving and interpreting at least one change medication schedule command from the user, and further including means for altering the prescribed schedule stored in the internal memory means in response to the receipt of a prescribed change medication schedule command from the external input means.

22. A system according to claim 1wherein the control means generates an error signal whenever invalid input is received and comprises a data file which includes a record indicating the generation of an error signal.
